t: Psalm 40
Thanksgiving and a Cry for Help
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
I*pn waited patiently for the Lord,*s and*ln he turned to me and heard my cry for help.
He*ln brought me up from a desolate pit, out*ln of the muddy clay, and*ln set my feet on a rock, making*ln my steps secure.
He*ln put a new song in my mouth, a*ln hymn of praise to our God. Many*ln will see and fear, and*ln they will trust in the Lord.*s
How*pn happy is anyone who*ln has put his trust in the Lord*s and*ln has not turned to the proud or*ln to those who run after lies!
Lord*sln my God, you have done many things — your*ln wondrous works and your plans for us; none*ln can compare with you. If*ln I were to report and speak of them, they*ln are more than can be told.
You*pn do not delight in sacrifice and offering; you*ln open my ears to listen. You*ln do not ask for a whole burnt offering or a sin offering.
Then*ln I said, “See, I have come; in*ln the scroll it is written about me.
I*ln delight to do your will, my God, and*ln your instruction is deep within me.”
I*pn proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; see,*ln I do not keep my mouth closed— as*ln you know, Lord.*s
I*ln did not hide your righteousness in my heart; I*ln spoke about your faithfulness and salvation; I*ln did not conceal your constant love and truth from*ln the great assembly.
Lord,*spn you do not withhold your compassion from me. Your*ln constant love and truth will always guard me.
For*ln troubles without number have surrounded me; my*ln iniquities have overtaken me; I am unable to see. They*ln are more than the hairs of my head, and*ln my courage leaves me.
Lord,*sln be pleased to rescue me; hurry*ln to help me, Lord.*s
Let*pn those who intend to take my life be*ln disgraced and confounded. Let*ln those who wish me harm be*ln turned back and humiliated.
Let*ln those who say to me, “Aha, aha!” be*ln appalled because of their shame.
Let*pn all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you; let*ln those who love your salvation continually say, “The*ln Lord*s is great!”
I*ln am oppressed and needy; may*ln the Lord think of me. You*ln are my helper and my deliverer; my*ln God, do not delay.
